unnormalised: Regarding the recent discussion on labor law compliance, it's important to note that Section 23 of the Industrial Disputes Act, 1947, stipulates certain regulations concerning strikes and lockouts. As per the Act, employers must ensure adherence to the minimum wage, currently at Rs. 176 per day in many states, as highlighted in Govt. Notification No. L-10/2023. Furthermore, compliance with EPF Act, 1952, and ESI Act, 1948, is mandatory, with contributions clearly outlined under Schedule I, Clause 4(b).
